commentary_data: Squad: Virat Kohli, Faf du Plessis(c), Mahipal Lomror, Glenn Maxwell, Shahbaz Ahmed, Anuj Rawat, Dinesh Karthik(w), David Willey, Wayne Parnell, Harshal Patel, Mohammed Siraj, Karn Sharma, Suyash Prabhudessai, Akash Deep, Michael Bracewell, Sonu Yadav, Wanindu Hasaranga, Finn Allen, Siddarth Kaul, Manoj Bhandage, Rajan Kumar, Avinash Singh, Himanshu Sharma

On a scorching Saturday afternoon in Bengaluru, the Royal Challengers and the Delhi Capitals will try to get back to winning ways. The hosts for today are on a 2-match losing spree while it's worse for the visitors who're even more badly placed, having lost all their four matches so far. RCB's bowling as usual has come into question especially after having allowed the Knight Riders to reach 204 from 89 for 5 and then letting Lucknow chase down 213 after being at 23 for 3 at one stage. It's always under the microscope, especially at the Chinnaswamy and they'll need a quick turnaround if they're to stop the slide. In that regard, the return of Wanindu Hasaranga could solve some problems, the Sri Lankan leg-spinner could be the glue that'd control the middle overs.

With RCB playing 6 of their first 8 matches at home, wins at the Chinnaswamy could give them a head start before their 5 consecutive away games. The Capitals are also on another extreme. Nothing much has gone their way - Prithvi Shaw has been a pale shadow of his previous best, the middle-order has looked volatile in the absence of Rishabh Pant and David Warner has been forced to play the role of an anchor. With runs being at a premium, the bowling attack hasn't quite been able to deliver. However, they couldn't have asked for a better surface than that at the Chinnaswamy to try and start a winning run.

'We're playing at the pitch number 8 and the square boundaries are at 61m and 66m while the straight boundary on one side is 70m. The average 1st innings score in afternoon games here is 157, it looks dry and there shouldn't be a lot of lateral movement,' reckon , in their pitch report.
'Josh Hazlewood is here. Obviously he isn't warming up or anything. Unlikely to play even the next one but he has a long chat with compatriots Marsh and Warner', pings our man  from the ground

I think the couple of losses are there, but we have been playing some good cricket. Just a few overs away from a few more good performances. We’ve come here today and we’re looking to turn that form around and chalk up another win. There has been some dew here, so there might be some tail towards the back end, we’ve not been at our best so far but hopefully we get some lateral movement towards the back end. The ball going sideways could help us out. The important thing is doing the basics well, if you smash hard lengths then it will be tough. Fielding is one thing we’ve spoken about in our meetings, it is something we control and our intensity and movements are something we pride ourselves on, so we’ll be looking to back that up today.

Four matches have not gone well, but we've kept things simple. It's time to upgrade our skills. This is a very important game. A win can get you into rhythm, which we're trying to find. We are like a family. The environment is good, it's a matter of one win. Of course there is disappointment of losing four in a row despite such good players. But we've forgotten about the four defeats, and are approaching this game as a fresh start. Have tried different things in these four matches, but nothing has worked out (with the bat). So today I've come in with a blind mindset. Will see the ball and play my natural game.

We are going to bowl first. The ground looks incredible, credit to the staff here. It's about getting one win, the momentum follows from there. We don't want to lose wickets in the powerplay. We have change.

Would have done the same. Hopefully it will turn in the second innings. This stays a good wicket generally. Will be important for me and Virat to assess the conditions early. It's difficult to defend in death overs. We have been good at our home ground as a batting unit. You got to pick your best batters and bowlers.
(Playing XI): Virat Kohli, Faf du Plessis(c), Mahipal Lomror, Glenn Maxwell, Shahbaz Ahmed, Dinesh Karthik(w), Wanindu Hasaranga, Harshal Patel, Wayne Parnell, Mohammed Siraj, Vijaykumar Vyshak
(Playing XI): David Warner(c), Mitchell Marsh, Yash Dhull, Manish Pandey, Axar Patel, Aman Hakim Khan, Lalit Yadav, Abishek Porel(w), Kuldeep Yadav, Anrich Nortje, Mustafizur Rahman
Suyash Prabhudessai, David Willey, Akash Deep, Karn Sharma, Anuj Rawat
Prithvi Shaw, Mukesh Kumar, Praveen Dubey, Sarfaraz Khan, Chetan Sakariya

Right then, we are ready for live action. The RCB openers stride out in the middle as the Chinnaswamy looks painted in red, like always. Pretty hot in the middle, so it will be interesting to see how the pitch behaves in this afternoon clash. Anrich Nortje to steam in with the new ball for the Capitals, a slip in place for Kohli, and here we go!
Nortje to Kohli, , starts off with a widish delivery outside off, Kohli shoulders arms. A comfortable wide ball
Nortje to Kohli, , starts off with a widish delivery outside off, Kohli shoulders arms. A comfortable wide ball
Nortje to Kohli, no run, pitched up by the bowler on off, Kohli drives it to wide mid-off watchfully
Nortje to Kohli, ,  Good length delivery around off, Kohli plays a fantastic lofted drive over mid-off and gets going
Nortje to Kohli, , smashed over cover this time! Good length delivery around off, and Kohli stands tall and spanks it over cover-point for back-to-back boundaries
Nortje to Kohli, no run, touch slower around off, was pitched up and Kohli defends it into the off-side
Nortje to Kohli, 1 run, short and quick on middle and leg, Kohli rides the bounce and clips this to mid-on for a quick run

Nortje to du Plessis, 1 run, 150.6kph, yorker length ball directed at the middle stump, du Plessis digs it out towards mid-wicket and scampers across to the other end. Good start for RCB and Kohli, 11 runs from it
Axar to du Plessis, 1 run, slower through the air on off, du Plessis drives this to wide long-off for a single
Axar to Kohli, 2 runs, great fielding by the fielder at deep square leg. Was flicked away by Kohli and it was stopped with a slide near the boundary
Axar to Kohli, no run, floated on off, Kohli drives it to the fielder at cover
Axar to Kohli, 1 run, touch fuller on off, Kohli drives it along the carpet to long-off
Axar to du Plessis, no run, quicker through the air, du Plessis knocks it to cover
Axar to du Plessis, 1 run, tidy start by Axar. Goes a touch fuller and du Plessis heaves it to deep mid-wicket for a single to end the over
Mustafizur to du Plessis, no run, slower one outside off, a cutter by Mustafizur to start his spell, du Plessis goes for a drive, gets beaten
Mustafizur to du Plessis, , shimmies down the wicket, swings and gets a thick top edge that flies over the keeper. Porel leaps, but this was just out of his reach. First boundary of the match for Faf
Mustafizur to du Plessis, , du Plessis joins the party now! The last boundary was a top edge, but this was really convincing. Dances down the wicket and spanks it over mid-off for four more
Mustafizur to du Plessis, 1 run, on the battter's pads as du Plessis works it through the leg-side with soft hands. Another slower ball by Mustafizur
Mustafizur to Kohli, 1 run, Mustafizur goes full on middle and leg, Kohli swings hard, gets an inside edge through backward square leg
Mustafizur to Kohli, 1 run, Mustafizur goes full on middle and leg, Kohli swings hard, gets an inside edge through backward square leg
Mustafizur to du Plessis, no run, low full toss on middle and leg, du Plessis shimmies down the wicket and guides it back to the bowler
Axar to Kohli, 1 run, quicker through the air, Kohli whips it through mid-wicket
Axar to du Plessis, no run, rocks back and punches this to mid-on
Axar to du Plessis, no run, shorter ball down the leg-side, du Plessis tries to drag it away, gets hit on the thigh pad though
Axar to du Plessis, no run, swings early, gets an inside edge towards the fielder at square leg
Axar to du Plessis, ,  du Plessis dances down the track and smokes this floated delivery over long-on for half-a-dozen. Chants of 'RCB, RCB,' engulf the stadium
Axar to du Plessis, no run, on the pads, du Plessis nudges it to short fine leg
It's so loud that that Warner (extra cover) and Dhull (cover) are unable to shout and get Marsh's (point) attention for a fielding change, says  from the venue.
Mitchell Marsh to Kohli, , Kohli greets Mitchell Marsh with a boundary. Puts on his dancing shoes and thumps it through cover for yet another four
Mitchell Marsh to Kohli, 1 run, slices this length ball towards cover-point for a single
Mitchell Marsh to du Plessis, , runs coming thick and fast from both ends! Was fraction short on off, du Plessis stays put and pummels it right over Marsh's head
Mitchell Marsh to du Plessis,  Caught!!

Mitchell Marsh to du Plessis,  Caught by Aman Hakim Khan!!  du Plessis was down the wicket to have a go at it once again. Heaves it towards mid-wicket and Aman Khan stretches to his right and takes it. Actually did well to get his hand to it initially, and took it on the second attempt as it was a really tough catch. du Plessis departs after playing a cameo!

Mitchell Marsh to Lomror, 1 run,  Was short and wide outside off, and Lomror plays a powerful cut. Manish stationed inside the ring gets his hands to it, but can't latch on to the chance. Could have been two wickets in two balls for the bowler otherwise
Mitchell Marsh to Kohli, no run, on a length around middle and leg, Kohli pushes it with soft hands to mid-on
Lalit Yadav to Lomror, no run, pitched up by the bowler on off, Lomror drives it with soft hands to cover
Lalit Yadav to Lomror, 1 run, tad short on middle and leg, Lomror rocks back and clips it to wide mid-on for a single
Lalit Yadav to Kohli, no run, makes room, backs away and slices it into the off-side
Lalit Yadav to Kohli, 1 run, pitched up by the bowler on middle and leg, Kohli plays a strong bottom hand whip to wide long-on
Lalit Yadav to Lomror, 1 run, on the shorter side, Lomror works it into the pocket at mid-wicket for a single
Lalit Yadav to Kohli, 1 run, DC pulling things back after that wicket. This was on a yorker length as Kohli shimmies down and squeezes it to mid-off for a single
Spin from both ends..
Kuldeep Yadav to Kohli, no run, tossed up delivery on off, Kohli heaves across the line, gets an inside edge on to the pads
Kuldeep Yadav to Kohli, 1 run, quicker through the air on middle and leg, Kohli nudges it through the leg-side for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Lomror, 1 run, Lomror goes down on his knee to swing this away, gets an inside edge towards short fine leg. Kohli for a quick single and they get it
Kuldeep Yadav to Kohli, no run, touch short on off, Kohli punches it back to the bowler from within the crease
Kuldeep Yadav to Kohli, ,  Fraction short outside off, Kohli slashes away from his body and gets a thick outside edge that eludes the fielder at short third man
Kuldeep Yadav to Kohli, 1 run, on the shorter side, Kohli rocks back and whips it through mid-wicket along the turf
Lalit Yadav to Kohli, 1 run, full toss by Lalit Yadav and Kohli drills it to long-on for a single
Lalit Yadav to Lomror, 1 run, tossed up delivery on middle and leg, Lomror works it through mid-wicket with a closed bat face
Lalit Yadav to Kohli, leg byes, 1 run, fired on leg, quicker through the air, Kohli gets hit on the pads as he tries to swipe this away, just a leg bye taken
Lalit Yadav to Lomror, 1 run, full and quick on middle and leg, Lomror squeezes it to long-on for a single
Lalit Yadav to Lomror, 1 run, full and quick on middle and leg, Lomror squeezes it to long-on for a single
Lalit Yadav to Kohli, 2 runs, width on offer, Kohli stretches forward and spanks this to wide long-off as they take a couple of runs this time around
Lalit Yadav to Kohli, 1 run, another full toss, but Kohli fails to put it away. Was whipped along the turf to wide long-on for a single
The run rate has dipped since Faf's dismissal and the spinners have done well to keep the batters in check. Plenty of batters waiting in the dugout, so RCB must keep looking for the boundaries..
Kuldeep Yadav to Kohli, ,  Width on offer, Kohli throws the kitchen sink at it and hammers it through cover along the turf. Right into the gap and no chance of stopping that
Kuldeep Yadav to Kohli, 1 run, down the wicket to drill the tossed up delivery to long-on for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Lomror, 1 run, flat and quick on middle and leg, Lomror whips it through the leg-side for a single. Struggling to time the ball at the moment

Kuldeep Yadav to Kohli, 1 run,  Kohli was down the wicket to chip it right back at Kuldeep Yadav, but it was a really low chance. Kuldeep Yadav gets his hands to it in his followthrough, but fails to latch on to it
Kuldeep Yadav to Lomror, 1 run,  Goes down on his knee to play the slogsweep, but the ball spins away, takes the top edge and balloons over the keeper's head. Lomror living dangerously
Kuldeep Yadav to Kohli, 1 run, on the pads, Kohli whips this along the carpet to wide long-on, just a single

Mustafizur to Kohli, ,  Mustafizur goes full on off, Kohli stays put and drills it right towards long-off. The fielder in the deep sprints and puts in a dive, but to no avail. This was timed too well by VK
Mustafizur to Kohli, 1 run, short of a length around off, Kohli taps it towards point with soft hands for a single
Mustafizur to Lomror, 1 run, short of a length around off, Lomror steers it to backward point
Mustafizur to Kohli, ,  Short ball at the hips, Kohli gets hold of it and dispatches it over fine leg for half-a-dozen. Strong use of his bottom hand again, such powerful wrists

Mustafizur to Kohli, 1 run,  And the RCB fans are up on their feet. This was pitched up by the bowler and Kohli flicks it through mid-wicket to bring up yet another half-century this season. Has been in sublime touch this year and he's making it count
Mustafizur to Lomror, , and Lomror joins the act now! This was short and wide outside off, and Lomror slashed it over point as the ball goes the distance.  - and the momentum is back with RCB
Lalit Yadav to Kohli,  Caught!!

Lalit Yadav to Kohli,  Caught by Yash Dhull!! oops.... Virat Kohli gets out to a juicy full toss. This looked destined for a six as Kohli backed away for a big heave leg side. But goes towards the longest part of the ropes towards deep mid-wicket where Yash Dhull judges it to perfection, almost hugging the touchline.

Lalit Yadav to Kohli,  Caught by Yash Dhull!! oops.... Virat Kohli gets out to a juicy full toss. This looked destined for a six as Kohli backed away for a big heave leg side. But goes towards the longest part of the ropes towards deep mid-wicket where Yash Dhull judges it to perfection, almost hugging the touchline.
Lalit Yadav to Maxwell, 1 run, fuller and sliding onto leg, turned towards deep mid-wicket
Lalit Yadav to Lomror, 1 run, flat delivery onto middle, punched towards long-on

Lalit Yadav to Maxwell, , Lalit Yadav flights it up just outside off. In the slot for Maxwell and he wasn't holding back. Swings across the line and puts all muscle behind it, and the ball sails over long-on... We're going to need a new ball
Lalit Yadav to Maxwell, no run, low full toss, drilled straight to extra cover. Lalit Yadav gets away once again...

Lalit Yadav to Maxwell, , into orbit!! This was pitched up and a bit quicker, Maxwell gets under it and swings it straight as an arrow. Over the sightscreen and deep into the stands, went high and long...
Nortje to Lomror, 1 run, fuller onto middle, Lomror with a shimmy inwards to push towards mid-wicket
Smart captaincy by Warner, getting the express pacer back when Maxwell walked out... He knows the importance of getting Maxi early
Nortje to Maxwell, 1 run, full and straight, pushed down to long-on
Entire RCB struggling against spin and then there is Maxi dominating spin like a boss
Nortje to Lomror, no run, slower length ball, Lomror was early on his swing across the line and missed. Ball goes over the stumps

Nortje to Lomror, , 1 run, oh dear!! This was a beamer at full tilt on the chest, Lomror does well to get some bat on it. The ball flies behind square and falls short of third-man. Called no ball rightly
Nortje to Maxwell, no run, yorker length just outside off, Maxwell backs away and swings, and misses... Anrich Nortje gets away!
Nortje to Maxwell, 1 run, on a length on middle, turned towards mid-wicket for a single
Nortje to Lomror, 2 runs, full on the boots, flicked to the right of Pandey at deep mid-wicket for a couple of runs
Overrate has been great from DC. Much better pace when the game is not going at a minute per delivery.
Mitchell Marsh to Maxwell, 1 run, I0$ full and straight. Maxwell shuffles in to drive towards long-on

Mitchell Marsh to Lomror, , slower back of length delivery. Lomror takes it on and pulls. Slightly early on the shot and he would have holed out on any other ground, but on the Chinnaswamy this is a 62m six just over deep backward square leg
Review for caught behind. Marsh is very confident, keeper Porel not so much. Ball does look close to the bat, and there is a clear spike. What an inspired review!!
Review for caught behind. Marsh is very confident, keeper Porel not so much. Ball does look close to the bat, and there is a clear spike. What an inspired review!!
Mitchell Marsh to Lomror,  Caught!!

Mitchell Marsh to Lomror,  Caught by Abishek Porel!! Big wicket!! This was a cross seam delivery very wide outside off. Lomror took a swipe and missed, but the ball did catch a faint edge through to the keeper.
Harshal Patel up the order again
Mitchell Marsh to Harshal Patel, no run, good length just outside off, punched towards extra cover
Mitchell Marsh to Harshal Patel, leg byes, 1 run, fuller and angles on the pads, deflected towards square leg for a single
Mitchell Marsh to Maxwell, 1 run, full and straight, Maxwell cleared his front leg for a big heave but adjusted. Turned towards mid-wicket for a single

The ongoing debate about Kohli's strike-rate is uncalled for. One look at BA-SRA (Batting Avg. + Strike Rate) should settle the debate. How many Indian batsman has higher BA-SRA than Kohli this season?
And no suprise to see Axar back with Lomror out. So much for match-ups...
Axar to Maxwell, no run, slider onto middle, deflects off the pads to the off side
Axar to Maxwell, , Maxwell backed away and Axar Patel fired in full at the stumps. Right into the swinging arc for Maxi who heaves it over long-on. Worked as per plan...

Axar to Maxwell, no run, gentle length ball, slow turner. Maxwell was way too early on the slog, and missed to get struck on the thigh pad. No real appeal - either too high or there was an inside edge there
Axar to Maxwell, 1 run, pitched fuller, driven to long-on

Axar to Harshal Patel, , And maybe that's why the promotion... This was fired in, but was a slot ball and Harshal Patel just swings through the line. Over long-on and into the stands, that's one way to get off the mark
Umpire review for stumping. Ohh dear, there is a spike actually when the ball goes next to the bat. The review was for stumping, but Harshal is out caught behind
Axar to Harshal Patel,  Caught!!

Axar to Harshal Patel,  Caught by Abishek Porel!! I0$ A speculative appeal for caught behind as keeper Porel whipped the bails out. However, upon the umpire review we learn that Harshal Patel got a faint edge on his big slog to a length ball outside off. DC get another wicket!!
Kuldeep Yadav to Maxwell,  Caught!!

Kuldeep Yadav to Maxwell,  Caught by Warner!! Two in two balls now!! This was a loopy delivery on middle, Maxwell backed away to slog but slices his shot. The ball only goes high and Warner from extra cover runs back to complete a fine catch. Suddenly, RCB in a spot of bother...
Kuldeep Yadav to Karthik,  Caught!!

Kuldeep Yadav to Karthik,  Caught by Lalit Yadav!! Team hat-trick for DC!! They've changed the script. This was a half tracker, was there to be hit and DK goes back to pull. Doesn't strike with enough conviction and holes out to deep mid-wicket where Lalit Yadav runs in to complete a low catch. Dinesh Karthik's lean patch continues, he generally waits a couple of balls before going for the big shots, even when he comes later on in the innings. Today he had the chance to build, but he's gone without scoring, opportunity missed!!
Kuldeep Yadav to Anuj Rawat, no run, hat-trick delivery and pushed quicker onto off. Rawat gets a thick inside edge which goes towards leg slip on the bounce
Kuldeep Yadav to Anuj Rawat, no run, tossed up delivery, Anuj Rawat with a forward defence
Kuldeep Yadav to Anuj Rawat, leg byes, 2 runs, fuller but goes on with the arm. Off the pads and between keeper and leg slip for a couple of runs.
Kuldeep Yadav to Anuj Rawat, no run, flighted up outside off. Rawat pushes it back to the bowler. What an over by Kuldeep Yadav!!
ICYMI, Anuj Rawat is the impact sub, he's replaced Mahipal Lomror.
Lalit Yadav to Shahbaz Ahmed, 1 run, length ball outside off, cut square of the wicket to get off the mark
Lalit Yadav to Anuj Rawat, no run, tossed up just outside off. Rawat defends
Lalit Yadav to Anuj Rawat, no run, flat on off, Rawat with a shimmy pulls but straight towards mid-wicket
Lalit Yadav to Anuj Rawat, 1 run, flat and coming in, Rawat gets low to pull to the left of mid-wicket for a single.
Lalit Yadav to Anuj Rawat, 1 run, flat and coming in, Rawat gets low to pull to the left of mid-wicket for a single.
Lalit Yadav to Shahbaz Ahmed, , fuller but slides down leg. A half-hearted appeal for caught behind but called wide
Lalit Yadav to Shahbaz Ahmed, 1 run, flat and coming in, backfoot punched towards mid-wicket
Lalit Yadav to Anuj Rawat, 1 run, juicy full toss, was there to be hit but Anuj Rawat gently turns towards deep mid-wicket for a single

Slightly puzzling tactics from RCB, sending Anuj Rawat as an impact sub ahead of Hasaranga. They are playing into the hands of DC who can easily switch to off-spin. And Rawat has only been blocking...
Kuldeep Yadav to Anuj Rawat, no run, flat just outside off, dabbed towards backward point
Kuldeep Yadav to Anuj Rawat, no run, quicker on off, Rawat gets back to push to backward point for a quick run but Shahbaz refuses
Kuldeep Yadav to Anuj Rawat, 1 run, short on off, cut square of the wicket for a single this time
Kuldeep Yadav to Shahbaz Ahmed, 1 run, flighted up and a bit wider, pushed towards covers gently for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Anuj Rawat, 1 run, flat delivery, punched down to long-on
This collapse can be an example to people who don't understand the importance of an anchor role
Kuldeep Yadav to Shahbaz Ahmed, , boundary after long!! This was tossed up, Shahbaz Ahmed shuffles in to take as a low full toss and sweeps it nicely behind square for four...
Nortje to Anuj Rawat, 1 run, full and straight, Anuj Rawat dances out but gets a tame drive to mid-off for a single
Nortje to Shahbaz Ahmed, leg byes, 1 run, on a length and skids onto the pads, deflects past the keeper to fine leg
Nortje to Anuj Rawat, no run, good length and angling in from round the wicket, lobs off the pads towards the keeper as Rawat misses the flick
Nortje to Anuj Rawat, 2 runs, steaming in onto the pads, fended away behind square on the leg side for a couple of runs.
Nortje to Anuj Rawat, no run, nice surprise bouncer, left alone by Rawat thinking it will be too high. But the umpires are happy...
Nortje to Anuj Rawat, , much needed, he really needed that shot!! This was a cutter onto middle, Rawat danced out and whacked it over mid-wicket into the big gap for a boundary
Mustafizur to Shahbaz Ahmed, , low full toss outside off, Shahbaz Ahmed shuffles in and drives in to the left of extra cover. Between the two deep fielders and four...
Mustafizur to Shahbaz Ahmed, , low full toss outside off, Shahbaz Ahmed shuffles in and drives in to the left of extra cover. Between the two deep fielders and four...
Extra cover moves to mid-off. Long-off goes very wide
Mustafizur to Shahbaz Ahmed, 1 run, low full toss at the stumps, driven straight and long-on blocks it out
Mustafizur to Anuj Rawat, 1 run, another low full toss, driven to long-on
Really don't understand the tactics from RCB by not sending Hasaranga and use out the impact sub when we know how much Karn Sharma could have impacted the game.
Rahman round the wicket now
Mustafizur to Shahbaz Ahmed, , once again a low full toss, this was at the stumps and Shahbaz Ahmed shuffles in to sweep it through a vacant square leg for a boundary...
Rahman back over the wicket. backward point inside the cirlce, square leg goes back
Mustafizur to Shahbaz Ahmed, 1 run, blockhole delivery, heaved towards deep mid-wicket
Mustafizur to Anuj Rawat, 1 run, nice yorker outside off, Rawat digs it into the pitch and towards long-on
Nortje to Anuj Rawat, 1 run, blockhole delivery, pushed towards long-on
Nortje to Shahbaz Ahmed, 1 run, slower length ball, slammed into the pitch and towards long-on again
Nortje to Anuj Rawat, leg byes, 1 run, lovely yorker from round the wicket, I0$Off the boots to the leg side for a leg bye
Nortje to Shahbaz Ahmed, byes, 1 run, superb execution of the yorker again, goes between Shahbaz's legs and the keeper with a slight fumble to allow the RCB players to sneak across
Nortje to Anuj Rawat, 1 run, low full toss on the pads, turned towards fine leg.
Nortje to Shahbaz Ahmed, , full and chasing Shahbaz as he backed away. Goes too wide on leg side

Nortje to Shahbaz Ahmed, 2 runs, full on middle and leg, Shahbaz inside halves his heave towards deep square leg. A fumble first there and there not a clean pick-up by Porel allows RCB to end their innings with two runs.

An innings of two halves!! RCB were 89/1 after 10 overs and looking good for another score in excess of 200. Virat Kohli teed off in the powerplay once again, and Faf played a few big shots too before a stunning take by Aman Khan at mid-wicket sent him back. Kohli and new man Lomror attacked Mustafizur, smashing 19 off his second over. The former RCB skipper got another fifty, but then holed out to a juicy full toss. Glenn Maxwell came out and went hell for leather against the spinners, got he was deceived into a false shot by Kuldeep. Then began a brain fade for RCB, as they lost three wickets in three balls across two overs, with DK getting another duck. A few puzzling stratergy calls as well, sending Harshal Patel up at 5 and using Anuj Rawat as an impact player - who stopped Hasaranga and Parnell from entering the game. In the end, DC would be very happy with the way they fought back in this game, but their batting unit has blown hot and cold this season. It could be an interesting chase, stick around...

The wicket was on the slower side, so I tried to hit the right areas and right lengths. I threw a few wide balls against Virat bhai. He (Maxwell) was going really well, I believed in myself, so I got him out, and next ball even got DK (Karthik) out, pulled the game back in our favour. Just trying to bowl in the right areas, if you do that, you'll get wickets. 175 is a good total as the pitch is on the slower side. Need to keep rotating the strike, especially against the spinners.

We're back for the chase..  and he's come on straightaway, Warner is the other man in, he's had runs, but his SR has been under question. 175 isn't a huge target, but DC will need a good start.. Siraj with the new ball for RCB, one slip in place

This was the worst use of an Impact Player. They should have sent in Hasaranga and Parnell and if they too had failed, then it would have made sense to bring in Anuj Rawat. Now they can't even bring in an additional spinner as they have used up the impact
Siraj to Warner, no run, good start from Siraj, hint of shape back into the left-hander, Warner is cramped for room as he stabs it to the off-side

Siraj to Warner, 1 run, short of a good length and at the stumps, Warner crouches across and pulls it past square leg, he was always coming back for the second and is slightly annoyed as Prithvi Shaw turns it down
Siraj to Prithvi Shaw, no run, Siraj shortens the length around off, Shaw prods across and turns it to the on-side
Siraj to Prithvi Shaw,  Run Out!!

Siraj to Prithvi Shaw,  Prithvi Shaw Run Out!! A direct hit from RCB's impact player and Shaw is OUT. That's a sensational bit of fielding from the man who just made all the wrong headlines,. On a good length and just outside off - Shaw stays on the back-foot and pushes it to the right of cover, the single was always on, but Rawat skipped across to his right, dived and made a one-handed stop, gets up and then throws down the stumps at the bowler's end, catching Shaw well short of his crease. Everything happened in omne motion and Shaw had no chance.
Siraj to Warner, no run, short of a good length and just outside off, nudged off the back-foot to mid-wicket
Siraj to Warner, no run, banged in short by Siraj - Warner drops his wrists and watches it sail through to the keeper
Parnell to Mitchell Marsh, no run, on a good length and slanting across the right-hander, Marsh covers the line, lifts his bat and lets it go
A slip in place for Marsh
A slip in place for Marsh
Parnell to Mitchell Marsh, no run, Parnell shortens the length and angles one across the right-hander - Marsh is in two minds and makes a late call to let it go by
Parnell to Mitchell Marsh, no run, on a good length and just outside off, Marsh prods across and defends it to the off-side
Finally RCB's Impact player has done something
Parnell to Mitchell Marsh,  Caught!!

Parnell to Mitchell Marsh,  Caught by Kohli!! A massive leading edge and RCB have two - short of a good length and angling inbto the right-hander, Marsh was shaping across on the flick, closed the bat-face early and gets a massive top-edge, high and down towards cover-point - Kohli is the man under it, he watches it all along and takes it with glee. Perfect start from RCB, getting back all the lost momentum from the back-end of their batting effort.
Parnell to Yash Dhull, no run, fuller length delivery outside off , Dhull leans into the drive and finds mid-off
Parnell to Yash Dhull, 1 run, back of a length and angling across the right-hander, punched to the right of cover for a single - 2 overs, 2 runs and 2 wickets so far

Siraj to Yash Dhull, no run, shout for LBW, but it did look high to the naked eye, Faf says the same and , there was an inside edge as well - the nip-backer and Dhull was caught in the crease as he looked to work it to the on-side

This is plumb, this is absolutely plumb, , did he get an inside edge? Only that can save him here - the bat is close to the inside edge, did it graze it on its way to the back pad? UltraEdge shows a flat line and it's three reds on ball-tracking.
Siraj to Yash Dhull,  Lbw!!

Siraj to Yash Dhull,  Lbw!! This is plumb, this is absolutely plumb, , did he get an inside edge? Only that can save him here - the bat is close to the inside edge, did it graze it on its way to the back pad? UltraEdge shows a flat line and . This is disaster for the Capitals, they're 2 for 3 now - the nip-backer from Siraj and Dhull was once again caught in the crease, to make it worse, he tried to play around the front-pad, was a dead duck once he missed and it's an easy call for the umpire.

Siraj to Manish Pandey, no run, Manish is cut in half now - Siraj is making this new ball talk, niped back from a length and burst past Manish's inside edge, only the bounce saving the right-hander as it zipped through to Karthik
Siraj to Manish Pandey, no run, short of a good length and just outside off - Manish is half-forward as he pushes it back at the bowler
Siraj to Manish Pandey, no run, banged in short and at the right-hander - Pandey drops his wrists and sways away from the line
Siraj to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, short of a good length and at the stumps, a cramped Manish manages to get the pull away behind square on the on-side, comes back for the second
Parnell to Warner, 1 run, fuller length delivery on off, Warner looks to drive and drags a thick inside edge past square leg for a single

Parnell to Manish Pandey, no run, another leading edge, but Manish is lucky that the lobe didn't go into Kolhli's hands at cover-point - reared on from a length and caught the shoulder of the bat as he looked to defend
Parnell to Manish Pandey, 1 run, short of a good length and at the stumps, nudged past square leg for a single
Parnell to Manish Pandey, 1 run, short of a good length and at the stumps, nudged past square leg for a single
Parnell to Warner, 1 run, back of a length and angling into the left-hander, chopped away square on the off-side for a single
Parnell to Manish Pandey, , , that should get Manish going - comes down the pitch, doesn't get too close and that allows a free-flow of the bat, drills it wide of mid-off for a boundary
Parnell to Manish Pandey, 1 run, short of a good length and just outside off, Manish stays besides the line and pushes it to the right of backward point for a single
Siraj to Manish Pandey, no run, Siraj shortens the length outside off - Manish rides the bounce and pushes it to the off-side
Siraj to Manish Pandey, 1 run, on a good length and just outside off, Manish lets the ball come and then dabs it behind point for a single
Siraj to Warner, no run, fraction fuller and angling across the left-hander - Warner stays leg-sided and then drops it to the off-side
Huge responsibility on Warner and Pandey to change it from football to cricket match.
Siraj is unstoppable at powerplay.
Siraj to Warner, , , too short from Siraj, sat up to be smacked - Warner swivels across and then hammers the pull over mid-wicket, couple of bounces and over the ropes

Siraj to Warner, , back-to-back boundaries for Warner - is this the release they needed? Short and down leg, he swivels across, lets the ball come and then rolls his wrists over the fine pull, runs away to the ropes in a hurry

Siraj to Warner, , , this is the best of the lot - on a good length and angling across the left-hander, Warner stays on the back-foot, doesn't go too hard on the drive and then finds the gap wide of cover, no need to run for those
Vyshak on debut in front of his home crowd, he's bowling to his Karnataka mate
Vijaykumar Vyshak to Manish Pandey, 1 run, back of a length and angling across the right-hander, Manish walks down the pitch and runs it behind square on the off-side for a single
Vijaykumar Vyshak to Warner, no run, short of a length anbd angling across the left-hander, Warner was shaping for the big pull and is undone by the away going angle

Vijaykumar Vyshak to Warner, , , Warner is looking in good touch today, back of a length and at the hips, he swivels across and then brings his wrists into play, used the pace and found the gap behind square on the on-side
Vijaykumar Vyshak to Warner,  Caught!!

Vijaykumar Vyshak to Warner,  Caught by Kohli!! A maiden IPL wicket for Vyshak and this is a moment to cherish. Huge huge wicket for the Royal Challengers and they're jumping for joy. Warner looks stunned, has a look at his bat and walks away - short of a good length and angling across the left-hander, don't think it came on as well as Warner expected, was through with the shot early and toe-ended the lob towards mid-wicket, Kohli ran in and completed an easy catch, RCB right on top now.

Vijaykumar Vyshak to Abishek Porel, 1 run, almost another, another leading edge on the flick and Abishek has just got enough to clear Maxwell, running back from mid-off - short of a good length and angling briskly across the left-hander, hurried Abishek on the tuck and nearly had him

Vijaykumar Vyshak to Abishek Porel, 1 run, almost another, another leading edge on the flick and Abishek has just got enough to clear Maxwell, running back from mid-off - short of a good length and angling briskly across the left-hander, hurried Abishek on the tuck and nearly had him
Vijaykumar Vyshak to Manish Pandey, 1 run, short of a good length and at the stumps, worked in front of square on the on-side for a single

A run-out check, Abishek Porel was coming back for the third, has he made his ground? The TV umpire will have a look, he did slide in and that has saved him, in by a frame. But is the bat in the air? Gough looks at a few replays and deems he's in - NOT OUT is the call

Shahbaz Ahmed to Manish Pandey, 3 runs, A run-out check, Abishek Porel was coming back for the third, has he made his ground? The TV umpire will have a look, he did slide in and that has saved him, in by a frame. But is the bat in the air? Gough looks at a few replays and deems he's in - NOT OUT is the call. Was a well flighted delivery on middle and leg, Manish went deep in the crease, used the pace and nudged it very fine - long chase for Harshal and he did well to make the stop
This is the first time a team has lost four wickets within the powerplay this season.
Shahbaz Ahmed to Abishek Porel, 1 run, flighted delivery on off, punched down to long-on for a single
Shahbaz Ahmed to Manish Pandey, , , a real dragdown from Shahbaz, short and at the stumps, Manish rocks back and then thumps the pull past square leg for a boundary
Shahbaz Ahmed to Manish Pandey, 1 run, flighted delivery on middle and leg, worked in front of square on the on-side for a single
Shahbaz Ahmed to Abishek Porel, 1 run, Shahbaz tosses one just outside off - his Bengal mate pushes it wide of cover-point for a single
Shahbaz Ahmed to Manish Pandey, 1 run, , flighted delivery on middle, Manish goes right back and works it through mid-wicket for a single
Time for Wanindu Hasaranga

Hasaranga to Manish Pandey, , .. and he starts with a real long hop, dragged way too short - Manish rocks back and then hammers the pull wide of mid-wicket, split the two fielders in the deep to perfection
Hasaranga to Manish Pandey, no run, flighted delivery on off, Manish backs away and picks out cover-point with the punch
Hasaranga to Manish Pandey, no run, slower and just outside off - Manish leans across and drops it to the off-side, wanted a single and is turned back
Hasaranga to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, the wrong 'un from Hasaranga, Manish played with the turn and worked it in front of square on the on-side, runs hard and comes back for the second
Hasaranga to Manish Pandey, 1 run, the leg-break now, but the length is short and it allows Manish to go back on the drive to long-on
Hasaranga to Abishek Porel, 1 run, tossed up on middle, Abishek goes well back and picks out mid-wicket
Hasaranga to Abishek Porel, 1 run, tossed up on middle, Abishek goes well back and picks out mid-wicket
Harshal, from round the wicket
Harshal Patel to Abishek Porel, 1 run, on a good length and just outside off, steered behind square on the off-side for a single
Surely RCB can't bottle this now
Harshal Patel to Manish Pandey, 1 run, short of a good length and just outside off, Manish hops across and works it to mid-on for a single
Harshal Patel to Abishek Porel, no run, on a length and angling across the left-hander, Abishek chops it hard and on the bounce to backward point
Harshal Patel to Abishek Porel, no run, fraction fuller and angling across the left-hander - Abishek is rooted to the crease as he aims an expansive drive and is beaten on the top-edge
Harshal Patel to Abishek Porel,  Caught!!

Harshal Patel to Abishek Porel,  Caught by Parnell!! Another leading edge and Abishek has holed out to mid-on - was a slower full-toss, dipped onto Abishek and messed up with his timing - he was looking to whip, gets undone by the late dip and is through with the shot early, pops off the leading edge and it's another simple catch to Parnell, right at the edge of the ring. DC slipping from bad to worse.

Time for the  - RCB have taken complete control over the match, but they can't sit easy, with the likes of Lalit and Axar still to come and Manish Pandey looking solid. Rawat set the pace with that superb piece of fielding and they haven't let the intensity slip until now
Harshal Patel to Axar, no run, fuller length delivery outside off, Axar leans into the drive and finds cover
Vyshak back
Vijaykumar Vyshak to Manish Pandey, no run, short of a good length and just outside off - Manish prods forward and gets an inside edge that rolled back at the bowler
Vijaykumar Vyshak to Manish Pandey, no run, banged in short, , Manish watches it late and ducks in a hurry

Vijaykumar Vyshak to Manish Pandey, 1 run, slower short ball outside off, saw Manish coming down the pitch and attempted the variation - swatted to the right of long-obn where Faf sprints across and keeps them down to a single
Vijaykumar Vyshak to Axar, 1 run, short of a good length and just outside off, cut away in front of square on the off-side for a single
Vijaykumar Vyshak to Manish Pandey, 1 run, back of a length and well wide of off, cut away square on the off-side for a single
Vijaykumar Vyshak to Axar, 1 run, Vyshak shortens the length around off, Axar was playing from the crease and gets an inside edge onto his pad, rolled to the off-side for a single
Vijaykumar Vyshak to Axar, 1 run, Vyshak shortens the length around off, Axar was playing from the crease and gets an inside edge onto his pad, rolled to the off-side for a single

Hasaranga to Axar, 2 runs, 88.4kph, length ball turning in around off, Axar pulls it hard and it takes a brilliant stop from Kohli to deny him a boundary. Lovely diving effort charging across from deep midwicket
Hasaranga to Axar, , googly on leg, and now Axar finds the gap as he nails the pull! Nothing Kohli could do about it
Hasaranga to Axar, 1 run, pulled in the air, goes on the bounce to Kohli at deep midwicket
Hasaranga to Manish Pandey, 1 run, floated up on off, quite full, Pandey knocks it to long-on

Hasaranga to Axar, , overpitched outside off and Axar !It's a googly that's floated up outside off, doesn't get the length right and disappears to the fence. Hasaranga isn't quite on top of his game out there. His lengths are either too short, or too full
Hasaranga to Axar, 1 run, flat on leg, on the shorter side, Axar pulls it to deep square leg
Harshal from round the wicket
Harshal Patel to Axar, 1 run, 135kph, full delivery slanted in on off, Axar knocks it to long-on
Harshal Patel to Manish Pandey, 1 run, 137.5kph, back of a length outside off, Pandey punches it to long-off. He was round the wicket to Axar, and over the wicket for Pandey
Harshal Patel to Axar, no run, slower ball dipping around off, Axar knocks it down the pitch in defence
Harshal Patel to Axar, 1 run, 139.1kph, length ball slanted into the pads, Axar clips it behind square for one
Axar Patel should have come up in the batting order for DC. He has performed consistently this season till now.
Harshal Patel to Manish Pandey, , banged in short, Pandey ducks and it's called wide. Maybe too high? Might've also been because it finished outside leg, not sure
Harshal Patel to Manish Pandey, 1 run, 134.1kph, length ball slanted into Pandey, denying him the room as he gives charge. He drags it off the inside half behind square
Harshal Patel to Axar, 1 run, slower one around off, Axar looks to drive, is early through the shot and drags it through midwicket
Vijaykumar Vyshak to Axar, , 143.2kph, short of length outside off, Axar goes hard at it and flat-bats it over mid-off
Third man comes up and mid-off goes back
Third man comes up and mid-off goes back
Vijaykumar Vyshak to Axar,  Caught!!

Vijaykumar Vyshak to Axar,  Caught by Siraj!! ! Big wicket! He floats it up on a good length outside off, Axar looks to loft down the ground but he's through the shot early. Goes high off the toe-end, and Siraj hangs onto a good catch as he pedals back from extra cover. Axar has been among the runs, and getting rid of him means that victory is well in sight now.
Vijaykumar Vyshak to Aman Hakim Khan, 1 run, short of length into the body, Aman pulls it to fine leg
Vijaykumar Vyshak to Manish Pandey, no run, short of length outside off, Pandey dabs it late but finds short third
Vijaykumar Vyshak to Manish Pandey, no run, slower length ball wide of off, Pandey looks to cut but it stays low and sneaks through to the keeper
Vijaykumar Vyshak to Manish Pandey, 1 run, 137.7kph, speared in full just outside off, Pandey drives powerfully to long-on. He couldn't get under the ball there as Vyshak got it right up
DC have good players in all departments but they somehow are lacking the glue binding them. That's the reason they are winless.
Hasaranga to Manish Pandey, no run, 90.5kph, flat leg-break around middle, Pandey steps out, doesn't get anywhere close to the pitch and tries to defend. Gets an inside edge onto pad
Hasaranga to Manish Pandey, , this time he does get to the pitch after using his feet and drills it down the ground! He has to up the ante now with wickets falling around him

Hasaranga to Manish Pandey, , there he goes again! Tell you what, he wasn't anywhere close to the pitch of it, but still manages to whack it over midwicket! It's a googly that's well wide of off, Pandey advances, has to reach out and somehow clobbers it over the ropes
Hasaranga to Manish Pandey, , flat on leg, pushed through by Hasaranga and Pandey uses the pace nicely to whip it past backward square
Hasaranga to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, flat on the pads, Pandey nudges it through the on-side and charges back for two.  for him
A review for LBW! Flat length ball sliding in, Pandey looks to nudge it through the on-side
Hasaranga to Manish Pandey,  Lbw!!

Hasaranga to Manish Pandey,  Lbw!! A review for LBW! Flat length ball sliding in, Pandey looks to nudge it through the on-side but misses. He's not too concerned, calmly taking a sip from a bottle of water. But that's when he hears the roar. The ball is crashing into the top of leg stump. Was originally given not out, and ball-tracking seems to have taken quite a few by surprise out there. Pandey gets to fifty, and then gets out the very next ball.
Parnell to Aman Hakim Khan, 1 run, short of length at the body, Aman tucks it through midwicket
DC's spinners ruled the roost whereas it is the pacers for RCB today. You cannot look too much into the pitch if you bowl to your strengths!
Parnell to Lalit Yadav, 1 run, short of length around the chest, pulled to deep backward square
Parnell to Aman Hakim Khan, , slower short ball around the chest, sits up for Aman who swivels across and pulls it over long leg
Parnell to Aman Hakim Khan, no run, 135.3kph, short of length around middle, Aman punches it gently down the pitch
Parnell to Aman Hakim Khan, 1 run, 138.2kph, short of length at the body, Aman pulls it to deep backward square
What a debut has this been for the youngster Vyshak, economical and two key wickets of Warner and Axar, just when they started to look threatening in key phases of the game
Parnell to Lalit Yadav, 1 run, 121kph, short of length outside off, Lalit dabs it in front of backward point
Vijaykumar Vyshak to Lalit Yadav, 2 runs, slower one outside off, Lalit gets low and drags the sweep through midwicket. No timing on it but it's in the gap and they get two
Vijaykumar Vyshak to Lalit Yadav, no run, slower bouncer that's well wide of off, Lalit lets it go and it seems to be just outside the marker. But the umpire doesn't signal a wide
Vijaykumar Vyshak to Lalit Yadav, no run, slower length ball outside off, driven to extra cover
Vijaykumar Vyshak to Lalit Yadav, no run, 127.1kph, length ball slanted in around off, Lalit swings across the line and
Vijaykumar Vyshak to Lalit Yadav,  Caught!!

Vijaykumar Vyshak to Lalit Yadav,  Caught by Maxwell!! Another one for Vyshak who's having a great time on his IPL debut! Slower knuckle ball outside off, it's in the slot for Lalit who slaps it hard. Goes straight to long-off!
Timeout!
Vijaykumar Vyshak to Nortje, 1 run, short of length outside off, steered wide of short third who makes a diving stop!
Harshal Patel to Nortje, 1 run, yorker around off, Nortje squeezes it through the off-side
Harshal Patel to Aman Hakim Khan, 2 runs, 135.6kph, goes for another yorker but is slightly short of the mark. Aman slices it through backward point
Harshal Patel to Aman Hakim Khan, 2 runs, 135.6kph, goes for another yorker but is slightly short of the mark. Aman slices it through backward point
Harshal Patel to Aman Hakim Khan, , 123kph, overpitched outside off, and Aman hammers it over extra cover
Harshal Patel to Aman Hakim Khan, , wide yorker attempted, fails to keep it inside the marker and Aman leaves it alone

Harshal Patel to Aman Hakim Khan, 2 runs, 138.3kph, again he misses the mark with his attempted yorker, bowls a half-volley outside off and Aman crashes it through extra cover. The fielder in the ring got a hand diving across
RCB showing the true value of playing at their fortress, which was needed from the perspective of a RCB fan as they play their first 6/8 matches at M. Chinnaswamy.
Harshal Patel to Aman Hakim Khan, 1 run, slower dipping full toss on off, Aman swings and toe-ends it to long-on
Harshal Patel to Nortje, 1 run, another dipping full toss, takes Nortje by surprise but he manages to knock it down the ground

A player getting injured, replacement player comes in and straight away makes an impact, this sounds way familiar for RCB fans, last year it was Rajat Patidar, this year it seems to be Vijaykumar Vyshak
Siraj to Nortje, , 140.1kph, back of a length delivery just outside off, Nortje flashes hard and itB1$. Nothing the keeper can do
Third man pushed back to the boundary.
Siraj to Nortje, 1 run, goes straight to that fielder who was pushed back. Back of a length just outside off, Nortje opens the face and the edge travels quickly to third man
Siraj to Aman Hakim Khan,  Caught!!

Siraj to Aman Hakim Khan,  Caught by Kohli!! Banged into the pitch on a short of length! Aman looks to pull down the ground, connects, but fails to clear Kohli at long-on. He's been busy on the field, egging the crowd on when not taking catches and diving around. His third catch of the evening.
Siraj to Kuldeep Yadav, no run, back of a length across off, Kuldeep looks to open the face in order to guide it towards third man. Beaten!
Siraj to Kuldeep Yadav, 1 run, full on middle and leg, Kuldeep flicks it through square leg
Siraj to Nortje, 1 run, low full toss at the stumps, Nortje drives to long-on
Vyshak was hit for only two boundaries and he came back and took a wicket on the very next ball on both the occasions. Dream debut!
Parnell from round the wicket
Parnell to Nortje, no run, back of a length around off, Nortje looks to cut and chops it off a thick under-edge to short fine
Parnell to Nortje, , slower short ball outside off, Nortje frees his arms and slaps it through extra cover
Parnell to Nortje, , slower short ball outside off, Nortje frees his arms and slaps it through extra cover
Parnell to Nortje, , slower short ball outside off, Nortje frees his arms and slaps it through extra cover
Parnell to Nortje, , four more! Short of length into the body, Nortje pulls it through square leg and it bounces just short of the ropes
Parnell to Nortje, , four more! Short of length into the body, Nortje pulls it through square leg and it bounces just short of the ropes
Parnell to Nortje, no run, Parnell hits back with a sharp yorker that hits Nortje on the pad as he's late on it. No appeal as it was going down leg
Parnell to Nortje, no run, Parnell hits back with a sharp yorker that hits Nortje on the pad as he's late on it. No appeal as it was going down leg
Parnell to Nortje, no run, full delivery slanted in, again Nortje is struck on the pad as he swings and misses
Parnell to Nortje, no run, full delivery slanted in, again Nortje is struck on the pad as he swings and misses
Parnell to Nortje, 1 run, Nortje advances, Parnell goes short into his body and it results in a mistimed pull through square leg
Parnell to Nortje, 1 run, Nortje advances, Parnell goes short into his body and it results in a mistimed pull through square leg
Harshal Patel to Nortje, , banged in short, Nortje advances and pulls through midwicket
Harshal Patel to Nortje, , banged in short, Nortje advances and pulls through midwicket
Harshal Patel to Nortje, 1 run, full toss on leg, driven to long-on
Harshal Patel to Nortje, 1 run, full toss on leg, driven to long-on
Harshal Patel to Kuldeep Yadav, no run, slower dipping yorker on off, Kuldeep squeezes it out
Harshal Patel to Kuldeep Yadav, no run, slower dipping yorker on off, Kuldeep squeezes it out
Harshal Patel to Kuldeep Yadav, 2 runs, ! It loops over the fielder at extra cover and falls safely
Harshal Patel to Kuldeep Yadav, 2 runs, ! It loops over the fielder at extra cover and falls safely
Harshal Patel to Kuldeep Yadav, , 121.5kph, full toss on the pads, and Kuldeep whips it through square leg
Harshal Patel to Kuldeep Yadav, , 121.5kph, full toss on the pads, and Kuldeep whips it through square leg
Harshal Patel to Kuldeep Yadav, , slower ball quite wide outside off, Kuldeep leaves it alone, and the umpire's raises his arms to signal a wide
Harshal Patel to Kuldeep Yadav, , slower ball quite wide outside off, Kuldeep leaves it alone, and the umpire's raises his arms to signal a wide
Harshal Patel to Kuldeep Yadav, no run, slower length ball angled in, Kuldeep swings and misses, and it bounces over the stumps! All over!
Harshal Patel to Kuldeep Yadav, no run, slower length ball angled in, Kuldeep swings and misses, and it bounces over the stumps! All over!

What a performance from the RCB seamers to defend the total convincingly! RCB were really poor with the way they handled things with the bat towards the end of their innings, and how they used their impact sub. But that seems a long time ago now. Their bowling, which is often accused of not stepping up, bailed them out today. Majority of the damage was done in the powerplay itself with Siraj and Parnell steaming in as the Capitals were reduced to 2/3. And then came Vijaykumar Vyshak to produce a brilliant spell on debut! He got rid of David Warner who was starting to look dangerous, before getting rid of the in-form Axar Patel. The final nail was the wicket of Manish Pandey, getting trapped LBW by Hasaranga who wasn't having a great game until then. The pitch was on the slower side, definitely not a belter that we see in the evening games here. And the batting woes from the Capitals continued.  for them now, with things looking quite grim.

- I didn't know about that (on having the best bowling figures on debut for an RCB bowler), have been working hard for the opportunity. Faf came and told me the wicket was holding up a bit, so I went with the hard lengths and slower balls which worked well. I've been working on these variations for the last couple of years. I wanted to bowl the knuckle ball, but Faf came up with suggestions on how to go about on this pitch. The management backed me well and Faf came up with suggestions often to help me. I was with the team as a net bowler

- I didn't know about that (on having the best bowling figures on debut for an RCB bowler), have been working hard for the opportunity. Faf came and told me the wicket was holding up a bit, so I went with the hard lengths and slower balls which worked well. I've been working on these variations for the last couple of years. I wanted to bowl the knuckle ball, but Faf came up with suggestions on how to go about on this pitch. The management backed me well and Faf came up with suggestions often to help me. I was with the team as a net bowler

I said at the toss we needed to do all disciplines well, but we lost three early wickets and we didn't chase down what should have been an easy chase. They (RCB) came out and started well with the ball, Siraj was outstanding. The positives were good - bowling and fielding was exceptional, the energy we showed was great too. Have to go back, we have five days off, have a hard look at ourselves, we need to do better with the bat and build partnerships at the top of the order. It is a matter of starting well with the bat. Teams have come back well from this position before and we can go on and do better.

I said at the toss we needed to do all disciplines well, but we lost three early wickets and we didn't chase down what should have been an easy chase. They (RCB) came out and started well with the ball, Siraj was outstanding. The positives were good - bowling and fielding was exceptional, the energy we showed was great too. Have to go back, we have five days off, have a hard look at ourselves, we need to do better with the bat and build partnerships at the top of the order. It is a matter of starting well with the bat. Teams have come back well from this position before and we can go on and do better.

We needed that to get the confidence back in the group. Especially the bowling group. Unfortunately we've had to defend for a few games in a row now, and it's not always easy at the Chinnaswamy. So very proud of them tonight. It's the first day game of the season. Also the new rule now - you always feel you need more. 175 in a day game here is a good score. But with the new rule there's some uncertainty. it proved to be the right score. But the way we bowled in the first six overs, not only today - in all the games. Siraj setting the tone beautifully. Generally the first six overs is most important with the bat. You want to play positive and get ahead of the rate. The way we bowled was just unbelievable. Huge credit to our seamers in the first six.

It was a tricky one. When it went up in the air, I made sure there was no one close to me. I made sure I grabbed it solidly. I was quite disappointed that I got out to a full toss. I've been playing really well. I wanted to make sure that after fifty, I was targetting 30-35 runs off the next 10 balls. That's how I play. That would've helped us get past 200. One thing I mentioned to the guys in the change room that 175 was enough on this pitch. It slowed down considerably when the spinners came on. Even the balls to hit off the back foot off Kuldeep were holding up, unlike the other games we played. We did well to get to that score and had the belief it was enough. When I've played my best cricket, those are the balls I've put away consistently (length balls on the up). That helps me to put pressure on the bowlers. When I put away their best balls, they're going to try to do something else. I back myself to hit good balls and the best bowlers in the opposition. That's how I motivate myself to play out there. Very happy to get two points. We kind of let it slip away last two games. For us to bounce back like this was very crucial. That was a different mentality and phase altogether (T20 World Cup 2016 semis). I was in a space where I felt I could hit any ball. I back myself to hit good shots. When they come off they look good.

The way RCB bowled today should do their confidence a world of good, given how their last couple of matches had gone. Capitals, though, continue to remain down in the dumps. The batting is just not firing, and it's five defeats in five matches now. So that's all from this game. The other match between LSG and PBKS is already underway in Lucknow. Hop tabs to catch all the action. This is Sagar Chawla signing off on behalf of Venky, Saurabh Shankar, Nikhil Jadhav and Pradeep Krishnamurthy.
